results.title: The Voice of the organ. No. 3
results.brief_description: Community hymn singing - hymns are sung by the choir of HMS Woolverstone whilst an unseen narrator encourages the audience to join in. The words are displayed on illustrated cards. At the organ, Fredric Bayco.

results.title: The Visitor
results.brief_description: The Visitor is a dramatisation of Ray Bradbury’s science fiction short story. “Blood Rust” victims are exiled to the barren deserts of a quarantine planet to prevent spread of disease on Earth. When a new arrival at the distant colony displays a mystical ability to recreate memories of Earth in the minds of the outcasts, his gift becomes the target of envy and aggression.

results.title: The United Nations and world disputes
results.brief_description: Excerpts from newsreels presenting the role of the United Nations in settling disputes in four countries between 1945 and 1950: the Dutch and the new Republic of Indonesia; the Kashmir conflict between India and Pakistan; Count Bernadotte’s and Dr Ralph Bunche’s mediation in Palestine; and the intervention of the United Nations in Korea resulting in a peaceful settlement of hostilities.

results.title: The Two paths
results.brief_description: Short drama about two sisters with two very different personalities, one frivolous and the other sensible, and the path they each take in their lives. Cast includes Dorothy Bernard, Wilfred Lucas, Adolph Lestina, Clara T. Bracy, Linda Arvidson, Florence Barker. Silent film with English intertitles.

results.title: The Tree
results.creator_credit: Georg Schimanski and International Council for Education Media
results.brief_description: Time-lapse photography helps us appreciate the marvellous seasonal changes undergone by a large oak tree. These changes also affect the many animals and insects that feed and live in the tree. Among other things, the film describes how the tree nourishes itself during the growing season, how it synthesizes various elements during the day and at night. The tree and the creatures who inhabit it form an impressive microcosm, kept in good health by natural checks and balances.

results.title: The Tragic pursuit of perfection
results.creator_credit: Enrico Fulchinoni and Triangle Film Productions
results.brief_description: An experiment in creating a dramatic biography from a painter’s work. The film covers a great deal of Leonardo de Vinci’s activities, explores his sketch books and notebooks, his extraordinary designs for machines of war, his correspondence, his drawings and paintings and his unfinished statuary. “The Tragic pursuit of perfection” is the theme of the film illustrated by the history of “The Last supper”.

results.title: The Timber jinker
results.brief_description: The role of the timber jinker in the Australian timber industry. The film shows various aspects of timber getting in the forests of Gippsland, Victoria; the manufacture of the timber jinker in a Melbourne factory; the transport of the logs from forest areas to the timber mills, often many hundreds of miles away.
